overview: Gino, an Amahuaca student and vice president of the Indigenous Federation of the Upper Inuya and Mapuya River (FIARIM), is afraid that the customs and traditions of the Amahuaca culture are in danger of being forgotten, and that is why he invites us to know to her grandmother in the Inuya community, and she shows us the tradition of Amahuaca weaving as part of the intergenerational learning between her grandmother and her grandchildren.
title: Wahii Topiki Nokun Jovi
